results.doc_title: Factor Form Weekly Tech - Business Sync
results.meeting_purpose: Weekly synchronization meeting between technical and business teams to align on product development, launches, and operational issues
results.date: Multiple meetings from Oct 23, 2025 to Dec 17, 2025

decisions.what: Launch OTP in W02 2025 to 90% of users
decisions.context: Decided against W50 and W51 launches due to developer availability risks during holidays and proximity to end of year. W02 is less risky with devs available for support and still before actual peak season

decisions.what: Stick to initial OTP flow designed by Megha, no changes to BAU flow
decisions.context: Decision made during Oct 23 meeting regarding OTP flow implementation

decisions.what: Not going with 'Notify me' option for NPD products
decisions.context: Finalizing decision on what to show on product tiles for Meal Shake/Creatine - choosing between 'Buy on Amazon' vs 'Buy on Shopify'

decisions.what: Gate 50% off discount for Factor Actives with $65+ MOV, with fallback logic
decisions.context: If RTE active, apply special voucher; if not RTE active, default back to regular voucher (40% off)

decisions.what: OTP pricing structure established
decisions.context: OTP price is fixed at original prices and cannot be discounted with vouchers. SNS has tiered discounts based on MOV thresholds

action_items.task: Add new meal_swap numbers for Creatine + Meal Shake before launch
Investigate W49 large week for tech errors in Factor Form CC Errors
Create 50% off discount id comm
action_items.owner: Hamed Karimian (double check banner behaviour), Amy Cheong/Laura Loughran (confirm with Megan Thomson)

action_items.task: Sync up with Jordon to find right event for OTP confirmation and cart abandonment
Work on distinction between OTP & SNS
Send email about raising price on Hydrations & Proteins
Sync up with Ronald about CC issues

key_points: OTP (One Time Purchase) launch planning and timeline decisions
OTP pricing structure: fixed prices with no voucher discounts, SNS has tiered discounts based on MOV (Minimum Order Value) thresholds
SNS discount structure: First box 40% off (MOV ≥$65) or 20% off (below threshold); Second box onward 20% off (MOV ≥$65) or 10% off (below threshold)
Demo of OTP on production and testing procedures
Mobile app prototypes demonstration
NPD products (Meal Shake/Creatine) launch preparation
Email communications with active users about price changes for Protein and Hydrations
Customer Care limitations: OTP only supports cancel and refund, not order changes, delivery address/date changes, or item modifications
Fulfillment & Delivery testing constraints on staging environment
VMS optimization of user journeys - retesting cart functionality after previous sliding cart experiment showed negative CVR impact
New discount banner feature discussion
Market softness expected W46 2024 - W04 2025 during end of year period
blockers: Can't test delivery on staging, must test on production before launch
Most developers out during W51/52 (Jordon, Jan, Edwin, Emily, Daniel, Travis)
W49 showed large week for tech errors in Factor Form CC Errors
Super risky launch timing close to EOY with limited developer support
Need to ensure Propac gets order info accurately for fulfillment
follow_ups: Test OTP on production before launch
Confirm voucher discount application logic
Finalize marketing plans for OTP on FF website with Ronald Weston's team
Retest cart functionality and user journey optimization
Monitor gradual rollout if issues arise

entities.name: OTP
entities.context: One Time Purchase feature being launched, with production demo and pricing structure discussions

entities.name: SNS
entities.context: Subscription service with tiered discount structure based on MOV thresholds

entities.name: Factor Form
entities.context: Platform experiencing CC errors in W49, main product system

entities.name: Propac
entities.context: Fulfillment system that needs to receive accurate order information

entities.name: Megan Thomson
entities.context: Person to confirm discount comm creation with Amy/Laura

entities.name: Ronald Weston
entities.context: Leads team handling Customer Care, needs sync on CC issues and OTP marketing plans

entities.name: Emily Stanek
entities.context: On-call for W50

entities.name: Paul Andrews
entities.context: On-call for W51/52

entities.name: Megha
entities.context: Designer who created initial OTP flow

entities.name: Alexandra
entities.context: Working with Hamed on OTP & SNS distinction

entities.name: Creatine
entities.context: NPD product requiring meal_swap numbers before launch

entities.name: Meal Shake
entities.context: NPD product requiring meal_swap numbers before launch

entities.name: VMS
entities.context: User journey optimization project, retesting cart functionality

entities.name: RTE
entities.context: Ready-to-Eat service used for determining discount voucher eligibility

results.doc_title: New Ventures Tribe - Weekly Standup Notes
results.meeting_purpose: Weekly standup for New Ventures Tribe to share team updates, people availability, on-call rotations, and project progress
results.date: 2025-W51 (week of December 16-20, 2025), with notes from W50, W49, and historical 2021-W13

decisions.what: First sprint of 2026 should start Jan 5 for all squads
decisions.context: Sprint alignment across Hellotech organization

decisions.what: Tribe-wide demo at the end of every sprint, recorded and shared
decisions.context: First demo scheduled for Friday, Jan 16, 2026

decisions.what: Q1 2026 on-call rotations split into two: L2 - New Ventures and L2 - Market Innovation
decisions.context: L2 - New Ventures supports client TRE for TPT, GoodChop & VMS brands; L2 - Market Innovation supports backend services until deprecated/handover

decisions.what: Q2+Q3 roadmap priorities established with Porterhouse leading
decisions.context: Hard choices between deliveries will favor higher priority projects (historical 2021 note)

action_items.task: On-call duty L2 - New Ventures
On-call duty L2 - RTE Systems/NV Systems
RSVP for New Ventures Tribe Berlin New Years Dinner
RSVP for New Ventures Toronto Xmas Dinner
Volunteer for Q1 2026 New Ventures On-Call rotations
Monitor Peak Release Calendar for Approved Deployment & No deployment Days

key_points: Multiple team members out or working remotely during holiday period (W50-W51)
Peak deployment freeze from Dec 20 - Jan 18, 2026
Sprint alignment across Hellotech with new demo cadence starting 2026
Q1 2026 on-call rotations open for volunteers with two separate tracks
Social events planned: Berlin New Years Dinner (Jan 27) and Toronto Xmas Dinner (Dec 18)
Anthropic visiting HelloFresh on Dec 16, 2026 (likely typo, should be 2025)
Historical notes show BFF migration near completion, route access control migration, additional vouchers support, and Alice API deprecation (2021)
blockers: Peak deployment restrictions from Dec 20 - Jan 18 limiting deployment capabilities
Multiple team members out during holiday period affecting capacity
follow_ups: First tribe-wide demo on Friday, Jan 16, 2026
Anthropic visit details in clan-genai channel
Peak Web Readiness Checklist completion
Q1 2026 on-call rotation finalization

results.doc_title: Factor Form Weekly Tech - Business Sync
results.meeting_purpose: Weekly synchronization meeting between technical and business teams to align on product development, launches, and operational issues
results.date: Multiple meetings from Oct 23, 2025 to Dec 17, 2025

decisions.what: Launch OTP in W02 2025 to 90% of users
decisions.context: Decided against W50 and W51 launches due to developer availability risks during holidays and proximity to end of year. W02 is less risky with devs available for support and still before actual peak season

decisions.what: Stick to initial OTP flow designed by Megha, no changes to BAU flow
decisions.context: Decision made during Oct 23 meeting regarding OTP flow implementation

decisions.what: Not going with 'Notify me' option for NPD products
decisions.context: Finalizing decision on what to show on product tiles for Meal Shake/Creatine - choosing between 'Buy on Amazon' vs 'Buy on Shopify'

decisions.what: Gate 50% off discount for Factor Actives with $65+ MOV, with fallback logic
decisions.context: If RTE active, apply special voucher; if not RTE active, default back to regular voucher (40% off)

decisions.what: OTP pricing structure established
decisions.context: OTP price is fixed at original prices and cannot be discounted with vouchers. SNS has tiered discounts based on MOV thresholds

action_items.task: Add new meal_swap numbers for Creatine + Meal Shake before launch
Investigate W49 large week for tech errors in Factor Form CC Errors
Create 50% off discount id comm
action_items.owner: Hamed Karimian (check banner behaviour), Amy Cheong/Laura Loughran (confirm with Megan Thomson)

action_items.task: Sync up with Jordon to find right event for OTP confirmation and cart abandonment
Work on distinction between OTP & SNS
Send email about raising price on Hydrations & Proteins
Sync up with Ronald about CC issues

key_points: OTP (One Time Purchase) launch planning and timeline decisions
OTP pricing structure with MOV-based discounts for SNS
Voucher discount logic and implementation
Mobile app prototypes demonstration
NPD products (Meal Shake/Creatine) planning
Price changes for Protein and Hydrations products
Customer Care support limitations for OTP (only cancel and refund, no order modifications)
Production testing requirements for OTP delivery with Propac
Tech errors spike in W49 requiring investigation
VMS optimization for user journeys and cart behavior
New discount banner feature discussion
blockers: Developer availability during W50-W52 (holidays) - Jordon, Jan, Edwin, Emily, Daniel, Travis out
Cannot test delivery on staging, must test on production before launch
OTP doesn't support order changes, delivery address/date changes, or item modifications
W49 had large week for tech errors requiring investigation
Market softness expected W46 2024 - W04 2025 over year-end period
follow_ups: Test OTP on production before launch
Gradual rollout strategy for OTP
Email communications with active users about price changes
Marketing plans for OTP on FF website coordination with Ronald Weston's team
Fulfillment & Delivery testing with Propac
Retest cart behavior and checkout flows based on previous sliding cart experiment results

decisions.what: OTP pricing structure established
decisions.context: OTP price is fixed at original prices and cannot be discounted with vouchers. SNS has tiered discounts based on MOV thresholds

action_items.task: Add new meal_swap numbers for Creatine + Meal Shake before launch
Investigate W49 large week for tech errors in Factor Form CC Errors
Create 50% off discount id comm and double check banner behaviour
Confirm discount comm details with Megan Thomson
Sync up with Jordon to find right event for OTP confirmation and cart abandonment
Work on distinction between OTP & SNS
action_items.owner: Simon Perez with Hamed Karimian and Alexandra

action_items.task: Send email about raising price on Hydrations & Proteins
Sync up with Ronald about CC issues

key_points: OTP (One Time Purchase) launch on production with demo and testing procedures
Voucher discount structure: OTP has fixed pricing, SNS has tiered discounts based on MOV (Minimum Order Value) of $65
Launch timing decision: postponed from W50/W51 to W02 2025 due to developer availability during holidays
New discount banner feature discussion
Mobile app prototypes demo
Price changes for Protein and Hydrations products with email communications to active users
OTP limitations: only supports cancel and refund, not order changes, delivery address/date changes, or item modifications
Fulfillment and delivery testing needs to be done on production since staging doesn't support delivery testing
NPD products (Meal Shake/Creatine) display options
VMS optimization for user journeys - retesting cart functionality after previous sliding cart experiment showed negative CVR impact
Pricing alignment between OTP and SNS
blockers: Can't test delivery on staging environment - must test on production before launch
Most developers out during W51/52 (Jordon, Jan, Edwin, Emily, Daniel, Travis)
W49 showed large week for tech errors in Factor Form CC Errors
OTP system limitations - doesn't support order modifications, only cancellations and refunds
Need to ensure Propac gets order info accurately for fulfillment
follow_ups: Test OTP on production before full launch
Coordinate with Ronald Weston's team on customer care support for OTP limitations
Monitor market conditions (W46 2024 - W04 2025 noted as soft market period)
Retest cart functionality and user flow after checkout
Gradual rollout strategy for OTP launch
